Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: D. Corbett
Reviews.Content: I was researching HD TV's to get to play 360 on when my large TV was being used.  Ordered this TV from Amazon (had shipping issues but not amazon's fault so won't get into that)Upon opening the package it looks real slick.  It was a snap to get it installed into the base, placed into position and turned on.  One thing I noticed right away is that the remote control for this TV works for both my Samsung 52" and the Viore (and the samsun control works for the Viore too)  After some googling it appears that Viore's are manufactured using a lot of Samsung parts.The internal speakers didn't seem very good but I will just be using headphones with this set (which sounds good).The 1080p looks awesome on 360 playing modern warfare 2.  Everything is crisp and sharp.Overall I am impressed with this TV.  It's easy to move around, cheap, and great quality!If you're looking for a cheap secondary TV for console gaming (360, etc)  look no further!

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Bad Sound, Decent Deal
Reviews.Author: Adam Jensen
Reviews.Content: I echo many of the other reviews I read before I decided to buy this TV.  For the price it has all the features you want and a pretty good picture.  The sound however is pretty bad.  I got it for my office and it should work fine in there, but I caution you if you plan to watch in a bigger room.  The speakers are actually on the back of the TV facing away from the picture.  It seems like a weird place to put speakers, and it results in the sound coming to you bouced off a back wall presuming its on a stand.  I have no idea how you could hear the TV if you wall mounted it or had it in an entertainment center nook or something.  If you don't care too much about sound then this is pretty good deal.  If you want good sound, I would look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: Operates on 12V DC - can use it  in your RV, boat, car, etc.
Reviews.Author: etm
Reviews.Content: It is well known from other reviewers that the audio is not good but a couple PC speakers can resolve this issue. The reason the sound is poor is attributed to the fact that the TV is very thin and as a result you cannot insert speakers with better sound because they require more depth. For the same season the manufacturer could not fit inside the thin housing the power supply. As a solution the manufacturer provided an externalpower supply (separate "box" with cords)but as it turns out this is not bad - see PROS below.CONS: Vertical picture viewing angle is poor. If you are in bed and the TV is slightly above the straight horizontal line the picture becomes too dark.PROS: The power supply for this TV is external (110 VAC input, 12V DC output). The TV power supply rating (stamped on the TV) is 12V DC at 5A. This means that you can operate this TV in your car, RV, boat, etc. It can be an excellent emergency TV. For emergency TV you may want to consider the smaller (22-inch model, consumes a bit less power.)The remote control of this TV also operates my two big Samsung TVs and vice-versa. I would speculate that Viore is a low cost "daughter" company of Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture - Great Value for a smaller room
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I am an avid year home audio/theater enthusiast and own and have a lot of experience high end home theater gear.We have been looking for replacement TV for our bedroom for about 6 months - I have shopped all the stores and was not satisfied witht the poor picture quality of what they had to offer for smaller LCD TV's.  We really liked the larger LED TV's but they were too big for our bedroom - then we accidentally found this TV on Amazon and decided to take a chance and I am glad we did.Great picture - I have it hooked up to a rooftop antenna and the HDTV tuner works great - no issues.  Played a standard DVD and it looks good as wellSound is fine for a bedroom, just turn the surround option off and increase the bass level and souds fine, but I think if this TV was in a room larger than 12 X 15 you would need some other speakers.Should note if the TV is above eye level the angle of the TV screen is tilted upwards, which makes it difficult to see - but you can simply angle it down and problem solvedIn summary - I cannot find fault with this product, we are very satisfied and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Works as a monitor and a TV, but not great as either.
Reviews.Author: Captain Practical
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom who wanted to use the same display for her TV and computer monitor to save some desk space.  The price was great, and since it's LED backlit the size is perfect.  That's about all it has going for it, though.Construction:  Very light and slim, which is great.  The base is very flimsy, though.  I was afraid it would break every time I hooked up one of the connections.  Also, it's tilted back at about 10-15 degrees, and not adjustable.  This is a good angle for use as a monitor, but no good when using as a TV since the viewing angles are not very good on this display.Picture:  As a Monitor:  Picture on the VGA connection for the CPU is good, but for some reason it looks terrible when using HDMI from a video card with HDMI output (same result from the DVI port using a DVI-HDMI converter).  I know what I'm doing when it comes to setting the correct resolution and all that, but the output through HDMI is just bad compared to VGA, which is the opposite of how it should be.  It's much too bright, and none of the video presets are good for use as a monitor, had to use the user-defined settings, which aren't great.  Viewing angles are bad as mentioned before, but about what you would expect for the price.As a TV:  Hi-Def signals look good.  Standard-def TV looks pretty bad, and 4:3 ratio signals centered on a 24" widescreen look smaller than I expected.  Again, the video presets are lousy, and I had to use the user-defined setting, meaning I have to adjust it every time I switch back and forth from VGA to TV input (something too complex for my mom to do).  The noise-reduction filter also only has 3 settings which range from too weak to too strong.  The warm and cool filters are both way too strong.Sound:  As has already been covered by other reviews, it's beyond bad.  It sounds like you're sitting next to someone at the library who has their headphones on full-blast.  Using external CPU speakers instead.Menu:  The menu is slow and unresponsive, too small for my mom to read, things are not where you would expect them to be.  The options you get are context-dependent, meaning the menu looks different for every type of signal, so you don't know what your options will be before you connect the signal.  It took me like half an hour to set the favorite-channel presets, only to learn that the interface for selecting the favorites is more cumbersome than just inputting the channel number.Remote:  Not good.  It has few buttons (which are small and hard to press), but for some reason the remote itself is bigger than any other remote I have.  The button labels are too small for my mom to read (ironically they put Braille next to the only 3 buttons that are already easy to find by feel).  It doesn't work unless pointed directly at the IR receiver, and since the TV is so sluggish, you constantly think you missed and end up hitting the button twice - very frustrating.Connections:  This is fine.  It has one of everything you need.  Could use one more HDMI.  I haven't tested any other HDMI devices besides the CPU, so I can't say if those would look as bad as the CPU did on HDMI.  Switching inputs is a pain because the menu is so slow, and instead of just switching to the next input with one button press like most displays, you have to select the input you want from a drop-down list.Overall:  It makes a decent 24" monitor using the D-Sub connection, but you could get an equivalent monitor for much less money.  What you're paying for here is the TV-Tuner, and as a TV it's disappointing (if you plan on using the built-in speakers, don't even think about buying this for use as a TV).  It is very sleek, slim, and light, though, if that's important to you.  I would would spend some more dough on something better next time around.

Reviews.Title: It is what it is- a Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Chartography
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. Now I am going to save some of you some time.If you have the TiVo HD with this use the Samsung code 305. The remote seems to have Samsung parts. So the set may have Samsung parts as well.For sound, hook up a set of 50 to 100 dollar PC speakers with woofer (you probably have a set of low-end Yamahas in the closet or your attic) to the headset connection. Sounds great! See a previous review about surround sound cuz I am not using this in my office. Display is great, has a nice collection of connections including two HDMIs's. For my TV/TiVO needs, I don't care about S-Video. I use an HDMI connection. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: some bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: R. Squires
Reviews.Content: In the last few weeks I've gone through several tv sets due to logistic changes and what not. After being relegated to the worst TV set in my household I decided to take advantage of the holiday sales to look for a new set. Black Friday's prices were nothing to right home about. I found an LED set at Best Buy that has 1080p and did some more research and found it just didn't have enough ports. I decided to wait and search for some new sets.Sure enough Amazon came through for me again with this model. If you're looking for a TV that does just about what you want it to do look no further. It has 2 HDMI ports, your usual component/ AV ports, and a VGA port with Audio in so you can use your TV as a monitor and speaker for your computer as well. You also have coaxial and RF which is good for set top boxes or old videogame consoles. It's missing S-video, and for some reason it has a 3.5mm headphone jack. The picture on this is great and since it uses LED lighting you have darker darks and lighter lights than conventional LCD's. The sound is pretty weak and using the surround option won't help. If it had better sound and an s-video port or two it would have gotten a five. If you're not picky and are just looking for an HDTV with no frills I recommend getting this.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: We owned this TV less than 24 hours!  Hooked everything up, watched maybe an hour and the TV went black.  Called customer service, who admitted a problem exists with the power adapter.  Power adapters are on back order and they won't even ship one until you ship them a copy of receipt.  We said, seriously, how about you ship me a WORKING power adapter based on serial number, for my BRAND NEW TV.  Nope.  Took it back, let them re-package with a new power supply.  Picture was so-so, sound poor.

Reviews.Title: Amazing HDTV if you have external speakers
Reviews.Author: Ken Kastel
Reviews.Content: My birthday is in the beginning of may and i got this present a bit early, 2 days ago I actually bought this when it was $230 instead of $300, so yeah.The Tv itself is 24 inches and outputs in 1080p. It comes with Component, 2 HDMI Ports, VGA, S-video and a Rf port.The Remote that comes with it is light, responsive and overall a good design.The Built in sound is pretty terrible. I played Some Modern Warfare 2 before i plugged in the Amazing speakers i bought prior to this, Basically, the built in speakers are really bad. It has a Headphones slot which can be used for headphones and speakers.Pros:- Light and pretty thin.- The best HD possible.- Sleak, Shiny Black Color.- Remote and Buttons are responsive, fast, and easy.- Picture is fully adjustable, same with sound.- Low Price (At least when i bought it)- LCD, Meaning no glares or outside showers appear on the screen.- Perfect size if your about 5-7 feet away from it.Cons:- Built in speakers are terrible.- 5ms response time, which can be good and bad for different people.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Mobile Users
Reviews.Author: Dr. Bologne Master
Reviews.Content: After scouring [...] and [...] for the perfect TV, Amazon.com had the perfect option.Viore's 24 inch, HDTV searching, backlit LED TV is lightweight -perfect for the mobile college student.After playing a few rounds of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, I noticed the TV kept up with the XBOX 360's 1080P output. I believe the refresh rate is 60MHz, although this may be an option for Noise value. Regardless, the TV kept up with my XBOX. No noticable screen lag or ghosting.LED HDTV = LCD HDTV LED-Backlit. Don't be confused over the packaging: LCD Backlit-LED is the same thing as an LED TV.  ([...]).Only qualm: The HDTV roaming did not pick up signals my other HDTV's have. I will configure more later to see if it's a setting issue.Overall, the TV is outstanding. The VIORE feels solid. The colors are vivid. The TV is lightweight. For [...], I couldn't find from any website an LED HDTV of this size. I've only had the TV for two days, but I am submitting a review to encourage any potential buyers to seal the deal.[Edit: The speakers are terrible. They are tinny and don't produce much bass. And I don't think the HD receptor works. If you're looking for a lightweight, vivid TV for a great price, then this is it, ONLY if you have external speakers. I have the Logitech S220 2.1 Speaker System with Subwoofer and it works perfectly. If, however, you need an all-in-one package, I do not recommend this product. Otherwise, i'm very satisfied with my purchase even a year in!]

Reviews.Title: Nice, Versatile TV
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Siefker "Boiler Maker Bob"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my home office. I use it to watch movies, satellite TV, and act as a large screen display for my laptop PC.  It does all these things quite nicely.  (Note: The VGA connector on the set is a 15 pin D female.  My computer also has a female connector, meaning I had to buy a M/M adapter. A minor inconvenience.) It is versatile unit with quite a bit of flexibility as far as how the picture may be set up.  I like the presets quite well and have not been tempted yet to play with settings.  Lightweight and easy to install.  Print manual that accompanies TV is short on detail and is not much help for understanding nuances of settings.  On screen menu is straightforward and easy to use.  Internal speakers are not very good. I plugged my PC speakers into the headphone jack on unit and they do much better. The TV also lacks an S-video input. (The sparse manual, poor speakers, and no S-video input keep me from giving this TV 5 stars.) I have not had the unit long, but I am impressed and pleased.  Nice TV for a very nice price.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: SB Leo
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these LED24VF60's from Amazon.com because after getting the 1st one, I liked the TV so much. It's surprisingly lightweight for a 24" TV (only ~ 11 lbs with stand) and the picture was bright & vivid on Blu-ray and HD channels. Some important things about the TV:The buttons on the top of the TV: Menu, Channel +/-, Volume +/-, Input and Power.I/O ports on the left side panel: RF Antenna In, Composite Video In, Component Video In, Audio Left & Right In (for Composite and Component Video).I/O ports on back: 12V DC Power In, 2 HDMI's, VGA In, PC Audio In, Coax Digital Audio Out, Headphone Out.Remote: RC3008V, buttons: 0-9 numeric keys, -/-- button for subchannels, Previous channel, Picture mode, Sound mode, Sleep timer (from 5 to 240 mins), Display (to show info of current digital channel), Vol +/-, Ch +/-, Mute, Thumbstick </>/Up/Down/OK keys, CC, MTS, EPG, FAVorite channels.Power Adapter: KPA-060F, 60W, Input: 100-240V, 50-60Hz, 1.7A, Output: 12V, 5A.The picture was excellent but the sound was pretty bad (like the sound from a $5 AM radio). It's understandable because the TV and its bezel are so thin, there is no way for the manufacturer to put big speakers on it. I hooked up a pair of Logitech speakers to the TV for good sound. This TV has 4 VESA 100x100 screw holes on the back with 4 screws included. Because the TV is thin, these screws should be used when we wall-mount or desk-mount the TV as longer screws might damage the internal parts of the TV. I first used one of the 2 TVs I bought as a PC monitor in my bedroom but the remote control of the Samsung T260HD in the same bedroom kept turning this TV ON/OFF and controlled it as well (The remote control of the Viore also controlled the Samsung shamelessly). It's pretty annoying so I had to move the Viore to another bedroom. Some websites said this Viore was built with Samsung OEM parts and I believe that :) . I believe we can use the Samsung codes to program this TV on the cable box or universal remote controls. I highly recommend this TV to the people who are shopping for a bedroom/small room TV that can also be used as a PC monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Ali32189 "Ali32189"
Reviews.Content: I received this TV as a early Xmas present. The picture quality on this TV is awesome! I also tried using this TV as a monitor since it has a VGA port and it worked perfectly. I don't know much about LED TVs vs. LCD TVs but like I said earlier the picture quality is pretty awesome and this TV looks really cool.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: Sabreena
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a couple of months now. It is the perfect size for a bedroom, has excellent picture quality and seems to have all the connecting ports you would ever need. It only had two problems which I rectified quickly. The sound is pretty bad, but I just hooked up my speakers from my computer into the headphone port in the back of the TV and now the sound is so much better. The second problem I had was getting my Comcast remote to recognize the TV but I just called Comcast and they helped me to search for the appropriate code. So if you do plan to get this TV, I recommend factoring in the cost of buying some better speakers for it or using some that you already have, but at the very reasonable cost of this TV, that should be no problem.

Reviews.Title: Not for a computer
Reviews.Author: InformedCitizen
Reviews.Content: I bought this 18 months ago thinking I could use it for both TV viewing and hook up my computer. Nope. the computer side of things is very poorly executed. Doesn't work much of the time and I have to keep readjusting the menu selections.The VIORE support was ridiculous. The person who answered the phone had a toddler in the background and she did not have any idea what my problems were. She didn't even understand what I was trying to convey to her. She pulled out the manual and tried to walk me through it. I had the manual right there and only called after going through the skimpy manual.When I asked if the monitor had drivers for the computer she had no idea what I was talking about.To date, the VIORE website is essentially non-existent. No help there. No support area other than one page to give you the technical support number.My HDMI input doesn't work.Won't let me view older 640x480 kids' gamesThe onboard menu is extremely difficult to use and navigate.

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: chamisi "LGS"
Reviews.Content: great bedroom tv I had to run external speakers they were so bad but like others said it's so slim how could you get a good speaker in the chassis

Reviews.Title: Viore GOOD VALUE
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Felton "Dick"
Reviews.Content: This TV was the right size right price etc etc however since it was an "off" brand it was a little scary to take a chance - even with it being such a good price. The reviews I read were all right on - the only downfall was the sound however a couple of good quality computer speakers did the trick. GREAT PURCHASE

Reviews.Title: Great Product! Great Price!!!
Reviews.Author: W. Drummond "Eway2929"
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this product because the price and specifications were exactly what I was looking for.  I became somewhat nervous after reading a few of the reviews but after receiving my product, I couldn't be happier.  The product is easy to set up and the picture is fantastic.  If price is an issue...think about this product...I'm glad I did!!!

Reviews.Title: Ok picture but worst sound
Reviews.Author: Liyanage M. Perera "malith perera"
Reviews.Content: TV is ok in picture but sound is nothing I've heard before. My wife said the sound quality gives her headaches. No base at all. No clear voice. You get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed-get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Trio Canine "video junkie"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this to see if LED really that much better thanLCD or plasma. In this case,no. I have 5 LCDs from name and house(BB)brands, as well as a Panny plasma, set-up throughout the house; and without exception, each has a better picture, is just as bright, and has a much wider viewing angle. I wanted to replace a 24" Samsung hybrid monitor/TV, but the Viore couldn't compare.The set is lightweight and pretty well built, but the remote is pretty flimsy. The set also is angled backward strangely, and the stand is not adjustable. Finally, there is no way to adjust the tint--you're stuck with the factory pre-set as far as I could tell.Amazon was great in terms of timely delivery and an easy return, but the images on the site are not 100% accurate. There was no "touch of color" as shown above, and the set shown below " From the MFG's website" must be for an entirely different model.Much better options for small sets are out there.

Reviews.Title: A Sweet Deal For A Sweet Product-Viore LED24VF60 24-Inch LED 1080p HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: H. Lapin
Reviews.Content: Viore LED24VF60 24-Inch LED 1080p HDTV (Black) Viore? I never heard of this product. I picked out the TV mainly to use as a flat screen monitor and I ended up with a wonderful TV/Monitor. The price was right. The specifications fit my need and I read all the reviews written on this webpage. After a few days of searching the web I decided to buy this unknown product. I had it in a week with free shipping. I opened the box and all was well. It took me about 10 minutes from the opening of the box to final assembly. All I needed was a screw driver (2 screws). I hooked it up and there it was a beautiful Hi-Def 24" picture. Who ever heard of Viore? Yes, the sound has a lot to be desired but I went into the menu and added some base and it sounds fine. Since when do small 2 or 3 inch speakers sound like 12" woofers. I love this TV/Monitor. What a buy. Don't hesitate if you are looking for a dual functional digital workhorse. By the way VGA, 2 HDMI connectors an abundance of inputs and outputs for short money. Buy it. Hey Mr. Viore you make a fine quality instrument and I worked in the Electronic Industry for over 40 years in Quality Assurance.

Reviews.Title: Good - Bad - Ugly
Reviews.Author: The Lorax
Reviews.Content: Good: 1080p (very bright high-def picture. All the latest and greatest cable connections. Weight (about 10 pounds). 24" LED LCD TV. Power Consumption.Bad: Viewing Angles.Ugly: Sound Quality - sounds tinny, the High-Def channel sound is not in sync with picture (looks like a bad lip sync karaoke). Remote Control buttons are not user friendly. TV responds very slowly to remote commands (seems like it takes at least two or three seconds for each channel to load (not good for channel surfing). Sometimes the TV will not respond at all, even when pushing the buttons on the TV. When the TV is turned on, it takes the TV about 10 seconds to boot up to a channel (about 3 seconds of this is having to look at a very bright full screen logo for VIORE - no need for additional in-your-face advertising).

Reviews.Title: Nice TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: ravenlrod
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice TV that doesn't take up too much room and doesn't cost an arm and a leg, this is the TV for you.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Money
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for only $200, so I am making my judgments based on that price.  This TV has a great picture, and while cheap looking, the base is not bad.  The controller is good, the only problem I have is that the remote also controls my Samsung TV and vice versa, which makes matters hard when I am using both at the same time to watch TV while playing video games.  I was a little disappointed that the tv did not have s-video connections, but this is not a deal breaker.  As for the sound, I read the reviews where everybody complained and I have noticed that the sound is not great, but what do you expect from such a small TV.  Right now I can deal with the sound, but eventually I will buy some computer speakers and hook them up.  Overall, I think this is a great starter or second TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: M. Spring
Reviews.Content: Other than the sound quality (which is lacking in almost all flat-panel TVs) this television works wonderfully.  Picture is crisp and brilliant, the controls are easy to utilize and functionality is great.  I would definitely recommend this product to others that are looking for a mid-sized television for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but no-frills.
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Procton "Michael Procton"
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed there was only one component connection, and this TV is pretty small, but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: 26 April 10 review
Reviews.Author: Fred L. Walterreit
Reviews.Content: Order was delivered on time.  The TV was easy to set up and the picture is great for the size.  One thing I did not consider was the sound for a small TV.  This set does not have good sound quality.  It would have been nice to offer a plug-in speaker(s) system.  Over all, it was a good buy after enhancing the sound.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for PS3; ultra-bright, slim, and a wide variety of connections
Reviews.Author: adr
Reviews.Content: I picked up this Viore 24" LED Display about two months ago to use with my Playseats Evolution Gaming Seat for racing games (and other PS3 playing).  I've been very happy with it, though I admittedly have not spent *all* that much time on it.  It's got a very sharp, very bright picture and is perfectly responsive for videogames.  I've used it extensively for Modern Warfare 2, Gran Turismo 5 Prologue, and LittleBigPlanet, all games look great and have very rich color.Because it's exclusively for games, and hooked up to an arcade-style seat, I have not used the remote, the TV functions, or the sound.  The remote looks pretty clunky and cheap, but I'm guessing it does what it's designed to do.Overall, I would highly recommend this TV for gaming, as my PS3 (using HDMI) looks crystal clear and has excellent contrast and brightness.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the price.
Reviews.Author: T. Williams
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice picture.  The audio is not the greatest, but overall a really good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good=Picture, Bad=Sound, Ugly= Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Steven Sanders
Reviews.Content: I know this is redundant but to remain consistent with the other reviews the picture quality is excellent and the sound quality is awful. External speakers work great and make the sound a thousand times better. Personally I bought Logitech S220 2.1 Speaker System (Black) and use them for the tv and my computer.Now, I'm sure that what happened to me is a very isolated incident, but my tv did not come with the power cord. After waiting for an hour on the phone listening to nice elevator music and being reminded that I am currently the 2nd person in line for an operator, I was instructed to fax my proof of purchase and shipping address to them so they could send me a replacement (This was on Dec 23rd). In the mean time I was able to barrow a cable from a samsung tv. Well, this might of gotten a 3 star if I ever got that cable. I called them again (Jan 5th) only to wait two hours and be told that they got my fax but they didnt ship it because the address I wanted them to ship to wasnt clearly stated (I wrote "ship to this address"). Its Jan 8th and I'm headed back to college with no power cord and the replacement is no where to be seen.To sum it up, by all means get this tv if you want a cheap tv with a great picture quality, but invest into something for the sound, and pray to your deity that nothing goes wrong so you dont have to deal with these infuriating people/answering machines. Personally, I'm going samsung next time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with HDMI to PC...
Reviews.Author: R. D Villanueva "The Dude"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased HDTV and I like it for it's price. I used it for watching movies and as PC display in my bedroom. Besides the audio issue (which to me really is not a big issue as i hooked it up to a X-Mini II Capsule Speaker), I have a problem with PC-HDMI connectivity. I have an HTPC with a DVI-I, VGA, and HDMI ports (which meant I could use three monitors at one time). I hooked up the HTPC to HDTV using that HDMI port and the display quality is just terrible. The fonts and everything else are blurry and I ended up using either the DVI-I/VGA ports when I need to use it as computer display. So at this time, I just use the HDMI port for watching BLU-RAY movies. Again, this is a good HDTV for it's price.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV becuase it is playing PAL format without additional equipment
Reviews.Author: kkr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV almost 12 months back, I took it to India and opened it today. I connected it Cable set box and hooked it using Component Cables.It is playing all the channels in color with out any PAL to NTSC converter. I didn't expect this and I am expecting a black & white picture and I am surprised. The picture quality looks ok to me on Component Cables. I will give thumbs up to this TV.Viore LED24VF60 24-Inch LED 1080p HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves her present alot and it looks great!!
Reviews.Author: Roxane3
Reviews.Content: This was a present to our daughter. She loves it - it has a great picture and the weight perfect.

Reviews.Title: good picture bad sound
Reviews.Author: charles
Reviews.Content: This TV was easy to set up., the connector were readitly available. The picture is very good but I was very disappointed with the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: J. Muench
Reviews.Content: As many have said before, the picture is fantastic on this set but the sound quality is very poor.  You absolutely must buy a USB powered speaker set to fix the issue.  Once that is hooked up, you have a great little TV for a nice price.  Mine is in the kitchen to watch when I am eating or cooking.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: E. Klein "good video buys"
Reviews.Content: A great buy.  Makes a excellent low cost computer monitor.  Also very good for HD television.  I have both the 22" and 24" Viore LED/LCD televisions.  No problems.

Reviews.Title: Very good!!!
Reviews.Author: Milton F. Fumero "linkm2cr"
Reviews.Content: Well this is a good tv, for a great price, the picture is perfect and is very slim and light; the only big problem is the sound that it really sucks, but otherwise it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: OK not spectacular
Reviews.Author: Floyd the Barbarian
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic low end TV. Do not expect a great picture just because it is LED. The best feature is the light weight. Picture quality is average sound is much below average.

Reviews.Title: For the price, you cant beat it.
Reviews.Author: DefJF
Reviews.Content: Other than the sound, this TV is exactly what i was looking for. Connections for just about anything.

Reviews.Title: Delivers for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Hwang "digital but analog guy"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great deal for the price ($250). I noticed it went up to $299 after I purchased it. I would probably buy it again at that price but would seriously consider a name brand for a bit more.The TV arrived quickly from Amazon with free shipping. It was perfectly sealed and I found no damages. There are ample connections and the only connection missing is S-video.I needed a TV light enough to move around from the garage to the backyard or wherever around the house I might feel like watching TV. It's thinner than an average LCD but not as thin as the more expensive name brand LED TV's. The build quality seems fine considering the TV is about half the price of a similar name brand model. The screen size is perfect for my portable needs--not too small and not too big.Up close (~2 feet), the picture quality is not that great. The picture using an ATSC antenna is pixelated but the colors are vivid. The farther away you get from the TV obviously the better the picture looks. Since you are likely going to watch the TV from 3+ feet away, the picture will look great and the colors stand out well with the LED back lighting. Definitely a more superb picture than a comparable plain LCD. The color is much better as well. I think that's what makes LED TV picture quality seem better--more vivid colors and not necessarily clarity. Plus, at a small screen size you can get up to 1080p whereas you might have to pay a premium to get 1080p on a regular LCD versus just 720p. I compared playing the "9" blu-ray on a PS3 on my 52" Samsung LCD with this Viore. The picture on each was equally sharp and colors strong. I can't say for sure that the Viore had better color but when watching other programs that's what I consistently notice the most--the color pops on the Viore. The color doesn't catch me as much when watching my Samsung.As other reviewers noted, the remote is a piece of junk. It's not responsive and feels cheap. The sound is fine for my purposes (used during exercise, cooking, or falling asleep in front of) but if you're planning to play games or watch movies you'll definitely want a separate speaker setup.For the price, $250, is a great deal and I don't regret spending half the price of a name brand.

Reviews.Title: Great picture. Bad sound. Buy at $250 & lower.
Reviews.Author: guyver
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom. My old tube TV had been annoying me lately so decided to upgrade.I am very pleased with the picture quality. I used one of the HDMI inputs with my Playstation 3. The Bluray movie looked excellent.The only complaint I have for the PICTURE is that along the top and bottom of the screen there are bright spots. It is very subtle and can only really be seen when that part of the screen is black (letterbox). I think this has something to do with the LED back-lighting.The connections on the back of the TV seem cheap. Not that they don't work but they feel cheap. My earphones went in too far which is usually an indication of a cheap product. And my HDMI cable almost didnt fit, barely enough room.Sound quality is awful. Like needles in your eardrums bad. Simply use different speakers. It does have a headphone jack so you have a lot of options for speakers.I am happy with this TV but only because I got it for $233 (out the door).Ill try and post a video review.Bottom Line: If you can find this TV for $250 or less, get it.

Reviews.Title: Despite the product title, this is NOT an LED, but it's still good
Reviews.Author: Kyle Jennings
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered this TV before Black Friday thinking this was a great deal for an LED TV, which it would have been if it was. However when i received it, I found it was LED-backlit. Having said this, it's still a good TV and a good value for a 24 in. (actually about 23.6 in.) 1080p HDTV.Positives: lots of connections on the back - RF, 2 HDMIs, component, AV composite, and even a PC input, which means this can double as your PC monitor if you want to save some money, and you can also hook up secondary speakers from another source. The picture - 1080p output capability means excellent Blu-Ray viewing and excellent video game picture (which is the main reason I bought this, and it has been awesome so far in that regard), contrast ratio is staggeringly low, but if you're like me, it does not bother you much.Negatives: sound - this is probably the most glaring fault of this TV, if you want to get it "loud" you need to turn it up VERY high, but well before you get there the speakers will make that sickening reverberation letting you know if the volume stays that high the speakers will be damaged very quickly. So unless you have a home theater system or auxiliary speakers hooked up, say from your stereo system (which the connections on the back allow), you will be mostly disappointed with the speakers. In addition, one time the sound randomly stopped outputting; couldn't figure out why but it eventually came back on, it was worrying but nothing huge. The remote - for whatever reason the remote becomes unresponsive occassionly, not really a dealbreaker, but it does have a quick closed captioning toggle button, which is a plus considering the sound is not the best.I bought this TV for $300, it was a good price then and is still a decent price. It has some problems, the worst of which is sound, but that can be overcome by the appropriate cable and auxiliary speakers. So far, I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: A Pain To Own
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Hodges Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it was cheap, and I thought it would have good picture quality.  I was right about those, it is cheap, and it has EXCELLENT picture quality, especially if you know how to set it up.  I knew ahead of time about the poor sound (and make no mistake, it is VERY poor), but like some reviews suggested, I planned on simply plugging some speakers into the headphone jack.  Doesn't work.  The Speakers don't make a peep when plugged into that jack.  I have a TV that I can't watch TV with, because it is apparently incompatible with my Dish TV receiver.  It refuses to see the Dish channel (you have to see the TV to a certain channel for it to see the receiver, and then the channel changes on the receiver itself to change what you see), so I can't watch TV on it.  I primarily bought it for my 360, and that works fine, but (apparently unfixable) terrible sound and lack of anything else to view on it sort of kills it for me.  Avoid at all costs, unless you fall into the very small demographic of people who are both deaf and only wishing to use a 360 with their TV.  Otherwise, this model disappoints, a lot.

Reviews.Title: How can I improve the sound
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to a previous reviewer.  Sound is extremely poor.  My $5 portable radio has better sound.  No bass whatsoever.  Very tinny.  I am very disappointed as now will have to spend additional money to try to improve this.  Picture is good, but Viore should try to rectify this.  Definitely would not have bought had I known just how bad the sound really is.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: tom
Reviews.Content: this monitor seemed too good to be true when i purchased it for around $200 last month.  it arrived and works, but worth noting that it DOES NOT HAVE A VGA PORT.  In addition, the DVI port would not communicate with my macbook pro *at all*.  the computer refused to recognize that any new hardware was plugged in.  Finally, i was forced to buy a) new monitor dongle for my macbook pro (DVI vs VGA), then b) a DVI --> HDMI conversion cable.the thing finally works, but EVERY SINGLE TIME i plug in my laptop, it goes bananas with the resolution and often never finds a resolution that works.  it took me 45min the other morning to find a resonable resolution that was a "supported mode" and which included all the computer screen info.dont even get me started on the "built in speakers."  what a joke.manufacturer offers zero support.  check out their web site---- its about 3 pages deep.bottom line: for MAC users, AVOID THIS PRODUCT.  i want to throw it out the window but getting a new one/returning is too much of a pain to bother with.

Reviews.Title: Had to return - shipped with a defective base
Reviews.Author: E. Webster "Smile - God is with you!"
Reviews.Content: I had to return the TV due to its being shipped with a defective base - in other words, it couldn't stand up by itself.  I have no idea if the TV itself was working since we never plugged it in.  Given that this was an "opened box/used" TV it would seem someone should have realized the base was broken!  Was more of a seller defect than a manufacturer defect!

Reviews.Title: NOT THE RIGHT SIZE FOR ME

Reviews.Content: It wasn't the right size for me.  Too small.  I returned it and got a 37 inch Panasonic.  I'm glad I got a bigger one.
